Title: Thresholds for Size and Complexity Metrics: A Case Study from the Perspective of Defect Density
Published: Software Quality, Reliability and Security (QRS), 2016 IEEE International Conference on
Summary: Calculating the threshold-derived risk to (a) the probability that a file would have a defect, and (b) the defect density of the files in the high-risk group.
Outcome:
Risk thresholds for size and complexity metrics have to be
used with caution if at all. Our findings have immediate practical implications: the redistribution of Java code into smaller and less complex files may be counterproductive.
